Okay. Here's the thing. I've read through the comments of other viewers --- some trashing the film and some saying it's the funniest, most feel good movie they'd ever seen --- and I really do want to agree with both sides. A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The townspeople form an angry mob to destroy the beast that is terrorizing their lives.
Based on the famous true story, this one and only hit should not have been made. A second print was slashed with scissors at midnight but the film had been withheld from several cities due to "excessive animal carnage
